name: =hyperlink("null", "What is the difference between a lead and a prospect? (ja)")
body:
"
  • A Prospect is a visitor who's IP address we have traced back to a specific company
  • A Lead is a Contact with a particular value in the Lifecycle Stage property who has converted on a form or has been added to your Contact database.
  • A Prospect can become a Lead.
"

  • A Prospect is a visitor who's IP address we have traced back to a specific company
  • A Lead is a Contact with a particular value in the Lifecycle Stage property who has converted on a form or has been added to your Contact database.
  • A Prospect can become a Lead.
"

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/contacts/if-i-hide-prospects-in-the-prospects-tool-will-they-also-be-hidden-in-the-daily-prospects-digest", "If I hide prospects in the Prospects tool, will they also be hidden in the Daily Prospects Digest?")
body:
"
  • No, hiding a prospect within the Prospects tool will not cause them to be hidden in the Daily Prospect Digest
  • However, they will be hidden if you export Prospects
"

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/contacts/how-can-i-hide-individual-prospects", "How can I hide individual prospects?")
body:
"

Within the Prospects tool, you have the ability to hide any particular Prospect that is listed. To do so, please follow the directions below:

  • Navigate to CRM > Companies > Find Companies, or navigate to Sidekick > Prospects
  • Locate the prospect you wish to hide and check the box beside it
  • Click the Hide button above. This will hide the prospect immediately.

Related Articles:

  • Does the Prospects tool exclude traffic from the IP addresses I filtered out in Reports Settings?
"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/contacts/does-the-prospects-tool-exclude-traffic-from-the-ip-addresses-i-filtered-out-in-reports-settings", "Does the Prospects tool exclude traffic from the IP addresses I filtered out in Reports Settings?")
body:
"

The Prospects tool includes traffic from all IP addresses. Visits from IP addresses that you exclude from reporting will still be tracked by the Prospects report. All other reporting in HubSpot will filter out traffic from the excluded IP addresses under Reports Settings. 

Related articles:

  • How do I block my visits to my website from being counted by HubSpot?
  • What is the best way to use the Prospects tool?
"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/contacts/why-is-the-daily-prospects-digest-email-missing-some-prospects", "Why is the Daily Prospects Digest email missing some prospects?")
body:
"
  • The Daily Prospects Digest email will display up to 15 Prospects in the email itself even if the total number states that more than 15 Prospects visited.
  • To see the remaining total Prospects beyond the 15 cap, click the provided link at the bottom of the list in the email \See the complete list here."
"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/account/how-do-i-activate-the-new-prospects-app", "How do I activate the new Prospects app?")
body:
"

You got to this page because you were trying to access the legacy Prospects tool. In order to see which companies are visiting your web pages
column6:
please activate the new and improved Prospects app located in our Sales tools.

\n\n

The new Prospects app now lives within the HubSpot CRM and supports better filtering
column9:
and presents a better user interface. The activation of the new Prospects should take only a few clicks.

\n

First
column10:
head over to the Products & Add-ons Settings page and activate the HubSpot CRM by following the instructions below:

\n
    \n
  • From your HubSpot Dashboard
column11:
click on your Account Menu > Settings
  • Select Products & Add-ons (Note: you will need to be an Account Administrator user role in order to access this setting)
  • Within the HubSpot CRM section
column12: click Activate (FREE)\n\n
column13:
then click Activate next to HubSpot CRM
  • Once you've activated the HubSpot CRM
column14:
you can access the new Prospects app by first navigating to Sales underneath the Marketing dropdown. 
  • Next
column15:
choose Sales Tools > Prospects.

Here you have access not only to the companies that have visited you
column16:
but also to a dataset of 19 million companies that you can start working today.

\n

Why the change?

\n

We found that the primary reason our users visited the Prospects app was for sales. That is why we wanted to keep investing in these use cases more and supporting filtering
column19: and multiple views. We look forward to hearing your thoughts and seeing how you use this tool. If you have specific feedback for us
column20: please share it by submitting an idea in the new Prospects tool (click the question mark in the bottom right-hand corner
column21:
then click Submit an idea).

\n"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/if-i-hide-prospects-in-the-prospects-tool-will-they-also-be-hidden-in-the-daily-prospects-digest", "If I hide prospects in the Prospects tool, will they also be hidden in the Daily Prospects Digest?")
body:
"

Yes - After you have hidden a prospect within your Prospects tool, such prospect will not appear in the Daily Prospects Digest email. 

"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/how-do-i-customize-the-properties-i-see-in-my-prospects-tool", "Can I customize the properties I see in my Prospects tool?")
body:
"

It is not possible to customize the columns in the Prospects tool. By default, the table will display the Name and Domain of each company, the Number of Page Views and Visitors, and the date/time Last Seen for each of your prospects. 

 

Related articles:

  • How do I create a Prospects view and subscribe to prospect revisit notifications?
  • What is the best way to use the Prospects tool?
  • How to add a company from Prospects into your CRM
"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/can-i-customize-my-daily-prospects-report-email", "Can I customize my Daily Prospects Report email?")
body:
"

When it comes to the Daily Prospects Report email, you can add specific views to the email, views that derive from filters you've added to your Prospects tool. In other words, after creating a particular filter, you can ensure that prospects that qualify for such filter are included in your Daily Prospects Report emails.

  • At the top of your CRM navigation, click on HubSpot Sales > select Prospects. 
  • Under All visits
column6:
click on Add filter to start creating a filter.
  • Set the desired filter using the available properties > when ready
column7:
click on Add filter.
  • Next
column8:
select Save this view.
  • Name your new custom view > Save view.
  • Locate the Subscribe button located towards the top right of your new custom view.
  • Click on the Subscribe button > enable the Daily Email toggle > Save. This final step ensures the prospects that qualify for your new custom view are added to your Daily Prospects Report email. 
"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/how-do-i-add-my-colleagues-to-the-daily-prospects-report-email", "How do I subscribe to the Daily Prospects Report email?")
body:
"

You can enable a daily email notification that displays a list of the prospects that have viewed your site. To enable the Daily Prospects Email, follow the instructions below:

\n
    \n
  • Navigate
column7:
to Sales Tools > Prospects.\n
  • Within Prospects
column8:
select Manage Notifications in the left sidebar.

  • A pop-up will appear with notifications settings. Click the button next to Daily Email to ON (the color blue with a checkmark) > click Save.

Please note: You can also subscribe to Prospect Revisit Notifications here. To learn more about the steps involved in that process
column9:
read this help article.

\n

Enable the Daily Email for your team

\n

If you are your team's admin
column10:
then you will have the ability to turn on the Daily Prospect email for  your team members. Follow the same steps as above and select Manage email notifications and add any of your team members' email addresses from that dropdown that appears just below:

\n

\n

Click Save to finish and apply your changes.

"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/using-prospects-in-hubspot", "How to access the Prospects tool")
body:
"

Please find below detailed instructions on how to access your Prospects Tool.

  • First, navigate to HubSpot Sales > Sales Tools > Prospects.
  • If you have not activated your Prospects Tool
column6: click on Find Companies to set a filter. In the case you have already set up your Prospects Tool
column7:
simply click on Website visits.

Ready to start prospecting? Click here to navigate to your prospects tool.

 

Related article:

  • How to add a company from Prospects into your CRM
"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/sequences/why-customize-sequences", "Why should I customize the content of my Sequences for each prospect?")
body:
"

Customizing your Sequences increases your reply rates and meetings booked.

According to a recent SAP report
column6:
salespeople’s value to their buyers will overwhelmingly be tied to their expertise. High levels of product and company knowledge far outpaced “good personal relationships” or even “sharing responsibility for business risks” in terms of what buyers want from salespeople.

\n\n

“With growing pressures at work
column7: highly informed buyers will continue to be on the lookout for a trustworthy and worthwhile vendor that gives them a personalized
column9:
” according to the report. “Vendors can prove that they truly understand their buyers by better anticipating their needs and providing valuable insights.” 

\n
\n


Booking meetings isn’t just about activity in today’s buyer’s market. The bottom line is to get replies and book meetings
column10:
you need to display your thought leadership and authority to your prospects.

Here are three effective and simple methods for customizing your templates and sequences to optimize for getting replies:

1. Demonstrate your experience

\n

Show the prospect that you’ve got a track record of success and understand their challenges and how you can help them.

“I have worked with other companies in {industry} and they all seem to face the same key challenge: [insert challenge].
Fortunately
column11:
many that I’ve worked with have been able to overcome this challenge by [insert solution].”

2. Give your prospect insight 

\n

Provide recommendations based your understanding of the prospect’s requirements. For example at HubSpot
column12:
we know that companies visit our site when they realize a need to improve or start inbound marketing.

“I've reviewed your website and have a couple of recommendations that could make an immediate difference in the effectiveness of your website in terms of generating more online sales. Here are a few:
- RECOMMENDATION 1
- RECOMMENDATION 2
- RECOMMENDATION 3”

\n


3. Show that you’ve done your research 

\n

Use the company's website and trigger events to find information about recent events or developments at that company
column13:
and frame those events through your own lense.

“I saw on your site that you’ve recently announced [trigger event] - that’s a huge step forward for {companyname}.
I see a number of opportunities for us to partner together over these developments
column14:
including [demand generating statement]”

\n

 

\n

For more examples of well customized sequences and templates
column15:
see our Slideshare on following up.

"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/why-is-the-daily-prospects-digest-email-missing-some-prospects", "Why is the Daily Prospects Digest email missing some prospects?")
body:
"
  • It's possible you don't see a prospect in your email because the prospect was previously hidden - these prospects will not be in your daily email.
  • The Daily Prospects Digest email will display up to 20 companies if you haven't subscribed to any custom views.
  • If you do subscribe to custom views
column6: the Daily Prospects Digest email will display up to 5 prospects per custom view you are subscribed to.\n"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/how-can-i-hide-individual-prospects", "How can I hide individual prospects?")
body:
"

Within the Prospects tool, you have the ability to hide any particular Prospect that is listed. To do so, please follow the directions below:

  • Navigate to Sales Tools > Prospects
  • Check the box(es) next to the prospect(s) you'd like to hide
  • Click the Hide button at the top

Please note: any Prospects you hide cannot be unhidden at this time.

"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/why-are-my-prospects-showing-up-as-having-visited-from-one-location-but-i-know-they-are-from-some-place-else", "Why does my Prospects' visited from location not match their actual location?")
body:
"

Prospects is meant to give you a general idea of where your prospects are accessing your pages from. TThe tool gathers information by recording the IP addresses from which the content is accessed. There could be a few reasons why the traffic is showing up as coming from one place, when it should be coming from somewhere else:

  • The visitor could be connecting to the internet through a VPN or another server which is located somewhere outside of their office.
  • The visitor's internet service provider may have redirected the traffic as a part of optimizing their service.
  • The visitor may be using browsing security software, which routes their traffic through another source so that they are removed from any threats on the web.

All in all, this is not uncommon due to the nature of the internet. That being said, HubSpot recommends that you take the IP address (and by extension, the location information) for your Prospects with a grain of salt.

"

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/creating-and-subscribing-to-prospect-views", "How do I create a Prospects view and subscribe to prospect revisit notifications?")
body:
"

By creating views in the Prospects tool, you will be able to filter down all of the companies that visit your website to only those that are relevant to you. You can also choose how you want to be notified when those relevant companies visit your site. Here's how.

 

Save a view

  • In the CRM
column6:
navigate to Sales Tools > Prospects.\n
  • Click the + Add filter button in the left sidebar and set the criteria for segmenting your prospects. 
    • \n
  • Once you've selected your filters
column7:
click the Save this view... button.

  • Enter a name for your new custom view. If you'd like your view to be available to other users
column8:
keep the Share this view check box checked. 
  • Click Save View. 

    • Subscribe to a view

    Once a view has been saved
column9:
you can subscribe to receive updates when a company in the view visits your site again. You also have the option to receive a daily summary of companies visiting your website. To enable:

\n
    \n
  • Within Prospects
column10:
select the view to which you would like to subscribe.\n
  • Under the filtering options
column11:
select the Manage Notifications button.

  • Toggle the checkbox next to Daily Email or Revisit notifications depending on your preference.

 

"""

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/prospects/what-is-the-best-way-to-use-the-prospects-tool", "What is the best way to use the Prospects tool?")
body:
"

The Prospects tool helps you gain insight into who is visiting your site. You can use the tool to help identify where on your site there are conversion opportunities as well as other businesses that may be interested in your product or services. The tool detects the IP addresses associated with each page view on your site and then provides you with your visitor's company name, location, number of visits, pages viewed, and more.

Please note that the Prospects tool uses the visitor's wireless IP addresses to track the visiting information, and tries to match that IP with the company to which it is registered. These IP addresses do a good job indicating the source of the visit but can only provide the information regarding the IP address that is made publicly available. Below are the ways HubSpot recommends using the Prospects tool.

Find companies ready for a sales call

If you notice that a lot of visitors from a company in your target market are visiting your site, they may be interested enough in your offerings for you to call them and start the sales process. The Number of Views, Number of Visitors, and Last Seen properties will provide a good perspective. 

Click on the company name to see more details. After clicking on the name of the company
column6:
more information about the company will appear on the right hand-side of your screen via the Prospects Sidebar. 

  • At the top of the panel you'll find basic information about the company
column7: such as Domain and Industry. Scroll down to see a list of related companies
column8:
as well as the company's recent activity on your site. See which pages and content the prospect is reviewing on your site. This information provides great perspective as to areas on your site where there is potential to further qualify your prospects.

Identify prospects by sales region

You can search for prospects by keywords
column9: such as state or country. If the term included in your search query is matched by a prospect
column10: that prospect will display on the list. If you have sales teams assigned to certain regions you can easily see how well they are doing. You can also train regional sales reps to pull these reports themselves so they can identify prospects in their region showing interest in your site
column11:
reach out to them and close deals. 

\n

To search
column12:
click on the search box near the top and enter a city or state. The results will show up right in the table. Please note that this is a keyword search as opposed to a strict state/country filter.

\n

\n

You can also use the Add filter option
column13:
located towards the left hand-side of the tool to filter by City and/or State.

See if an existing lead is engaged

You can use the Prospects tool to see whether anyone from a company you are pursuing is actually visiting your site. Maybe a certain prospect hasn't returned your call or replied to your email yet
column14: but if that prospect is on your site
column15:
it’s worth continuing your effort because they’re actually engaged.

\n

If you see that a company comes to your site and checks out certain pages after you’ve delivered an RFP or had a sales meeting
column16:
you’ll have a clearer picture of how engaged they are and what they’re interested in. This information allows you to be extremely informed as talks with the prospect continue. Click on the company name to view the Prospects Sidebar. Scroll down to the Recent Activity section to see information about the company's recent activity on your site.

Favorite or Hide a prospect

 You have the option to favorite or hide prospects. You may want to hide a prospect if it is a competitor that you don't care to track. You may want to favorite a prospect if you want to return to their information at a later date.

To hide a prospect
column17: select the checkbox next to prospect
column18:
and click on Hide.

\n

\n

To favorite a prospect
column19:
select the Star button next to the prospect.  

See what your competitors are looking at

 Competitors are likely to come to your website but are very unlikely to fill out any forms
column20: since that would alert you to their presence on your site. You can use the Prospects tool to keep an eye out for competing companies
column21:
then drill down and see which pages your competitors are visiting on your site. Knowing what it is about your offerings that competitors find interesting can be valuable information.

\n

Upsell existing customers

\n

 If you see an existing customer listed in the Prospects tool
column22: drill down and see what pages visitors from that company are checking out. It could be that they’re interested in subjects
column24: or services of which you were unaware. Armed with that knowledge
column25: you can do much more effective relationship management
column26:
and even upsell.

Daily Prospects Report email notification

 You can enable a daily email notification that displays a list of the prospects that have viewed your site. To enable the Daily Pospects Notification:

  • Within Prospects
column27:
select Manage Notifications in the left sidebar

  • Next
column28: a box will appear with options for subscribing to receive Revisit Notification based on one of your saved Views
column29: or to enable a Daily Prospect Email. Check off whichever you prefer
column30:
or both.

 You can also customize your Daily Prospects Report email. For more details

name: =hyperlink("https://knowledge.hubspot.com/articles/kcs_article/companies/what-is-the-insights-database-im-seeing-on-my-companies-and-prospects", "What is the Insights database I'm seeing on my companies and prospects?")
body:
"

While looking at a company in the HubSpot Sales product, you will see a \Powered by HubSpot Insights\" note at the end of your company's About card. When you hover over a property that has been filled in via the HubSpot Insights database
column6:
you'll see an orange notification indicating how this information was filled:

 HubSpot Insights is a database put together by HubSpot using a proprietary algorithm that gathers information on companies from various third-party sources across the web.

"""
